page.title: 18WILLIAM McGONAGALL, DUNDEE
page.content: William McGonagall was born in 1825, the son of Irish immigrants.He moved to DUNDEE and lived in{Patons Lane} and later{Step Row.}He became a well- known celebrity in Dundee during his lifetime with public performances of his own poetry and his unique brand of Shakespeare in the 1870's and 80's. Many of his works have been reissued by{Winters,}a Dundee publisher,and are now read around the world. Extracts from his best-known works might include { "Beautiful Railway Bridge of the {Silvery Tay! { The longest of the present day { That has ever crossed o'er a tidal { river stream, { Most gigantic to be seen, { Near by Dundee and the Magdalen { } {Green." He died in 1902.
